articles.title: Congratulations to Kim Jong Un from Syrian President
articles.content:
Congratulations to Kim Jong Un from Syrian President
						
 Pyongyang, July 23 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK, received a congratulatory message from Syrian President Bashar Al-Assad on July 21.
					 The message said he was pleased to pay warmest congratulations to His Excellency Kim Jong Un and the friendly Korean people on behalf of the Syrian people and on his own behalf on the occasion of July 27, 2013, the 60th anniversary of the victory in the Fatherland Liberation War. 
					
					 He wished Kim Jong Un happiness in good health and the friendly Korean people prosperity.
					
					 Availing himself of the opportunity, he expressed his belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the Syrian Arab Republic and the Democratic People's Republic of Korea would steadily grow in the interests of the peoples of the two countries.

articles.title: War Veteran Delegates Here
articles.content:
War Veteran Delegates Here
 Pyongyang, July 23 (KCNA) -- War veteran delegates arrived here amid warm welcome from people across the country on Tuesday to take part in the celebrations of the 60th anniversary of the victory in the great Fatherland Liberation War. 
					 Trains and buses carrying defenders of the country in the 1950s arrived at Pyongyang Railway Station and lodgings. 
					
					 They were warmly welcomed by Kim Ki Nam, Choe Thae Bok, Kwak Pom Gi, Jo Yon Jun and other officials of the C.C., the Workers' Party of Korea, officials concerned and people from all walks of life and employees of the lodgings. 
					
					 Pyongyang Railway Station and streets were crowded with citizens and school children who presented the sea of flowers to welcome them. 
					
					 The war veterans felt deep gratitude for the mother party which invariably put them forward as revolutionary forerunners who fought to defend the country risking their lives and the precious national treasure though six decades have passed since the war ended in victory of the Korean people.

articles.title: Congratulatory Group of Koreans in Japan Arrives
articles.content:
Congratulatory Group of Koreans in Japan Arrives
						
 Pyongyang, July 23 (KCNA) -- A congratulatory group of Koreans in Japan headed by Hong In Hum, chairman of the Central Audit Committee of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan, arrived here on Tuesday to take part in the celebrations of the 60th anniversary of the victory in the great Fatherland Liberation War.

articles.title: Delegation of Koreans in China Arrives
articles.content:
Delegation of Koreans in China Arrives
 Pyongyang, July 23 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the General Association of Koreans in China led by Chairwoman Choe Un Bok arrived here Tuesday by train to take part in the celebrations of the 60th anniversary of the victory in the great Fatherland Liberation War.

articles.title: Delegation of Korean War Veterans in China Here
articles.content:
Delegation of Korean War Veterans in China Here
						
 Pyongyang, July 23 (KCNA) -- A delegation of Korean war veterans in China led by Kim Kang Hui, head of the lecturers group of veterans of the Chinese People's Volunteers, arrived here Tuesday to participate in the celebrations of the 60th anniversary of the victory in the great Fatherland Liberation War.

articles.title: Chinese, Koreans in China Arrive
articles.content:
Chinese, Koreans in China Arrive
 Pyongyang, July 23 (KCNA) -- Families of Chai Shiying, Jiang Zihua, Zhang Shoujian and Wang Minggui, Chinese related to the anti-Japanese revolutionary struggle, and family of Kim Sun Ok, a Korean related to the anti-Japanese revolutionary struggle in China, arrived here by train on Tuesday to take part in the celebrations of the 60th anniversary of the victory in the great Fatherland Liberation War. 
					 Arriving here by air on the same day was the family of Jong Il Sim, a Korean in Russia.

articles.title: Overseas Koreans Here
articles.content:
Overseas Koreans Here
						
 Pyongyang, July 23 (KCNA) -- Delegations of overseas Koreans arrived here by air on Tuesday to celebrate the 60th anniversary of the victory in the great Fatherland Liberation War.
					 They include a delegation of the Federation of Koreans in the U.S. led by Chairman Yun Kil Sang, delegation of the Federation of Koreans in Canada headed by Chairman Kim Su Hae and a delegation of the International United Confederation of Koreans led by First Vice-Chairman Kim Chil Song.
					
					 A delegation of the Chinese region of the Society for Disseminating and Supporting Immortal Flowers led by Choe Ryong Ho, vice-president of Yanbian University of Science and Technology of China. arrived here by train on the same day.

articles.title: Foreign Guests Here
articles.content:
Foreign Guests Here
 Pyongyang, July 23 (KCNA) -- Foreign guests arrived here Monday to take part in the celebrations of the 60th anniversary of the Korean people's victory in the great Fatherland Liberation War (Korean War) and international solidarity events. 
					 They are the delegation of the Australia-DPRK Association for Friendship and Culture led by National Secretary Raymond Ferguson, delegation of the Federation of Peace and Friendship Organizations of Mongolia led by General Secretary G. Dugarjav, delegation of the Indonesia-Korea Association for Friendship and Cultural Exchange led by Secretary General Teguh Santosa, delegation of the Sweden-Korea Friendship Association led by Vice-Chairman Torbjorn Bjorkman, delegation of the New Zealand-DPRK Society led by Secretary Peter Wilson, Shanghai law and investment delegation of China headed by Lenon Woo, director of the Shanghai Promise Law Firm, Executive Director of the Environmental Education Media Project Kosima Weber Liu, delegate of the Pakistan-Korea Friendship Association Zabed Ansari, friendship delegate of Ireland Irina Malenko, Italian freelancer Alessandro Belgiojoso and delegation of the Slovenia-Korea Friendship Association led by Chairman Igor Jurisic.

articles.title: Foreign Delegations, Guests Visit Kumsusan Palace of Sun
articles.content:
Foreign Delegations, Guests Visit Kumsusan Palace of Sun
						
 Pyongyang, July 23 (KCNA) -- Delegations and delegates from various countries and international organizations visited the Kumsusan Palace of the Sun to pay tribute to President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il on Tuesday.
					 They came here to take part in the celebrations of the 60th anniversary of the Korean people's victory in the great Fatherland Liberation War and international solidarity events. 
					
					 They paid tribute to the Generalissimos Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il before their statues. 
					
					 Then they paid homage to the Generalissimos in the halls where they lie in state.
					
					 They looked round the halls where the orders the Generalissimos received are on display and halls which house cars, electric car, boat and train coaches they used during their field guidance and foreign trips till the last moments of their lives.
					
					 They made entries in the visitor's book.
					
					 Irina Malenko, friendship delegate from Ireland, wrote that she extended thanks to Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il for their great contribution to the cause of global independence.
					
					 Peter Wilson, head of the delegation of the New Zealand-DPRK Society, wrote he deemed it great honor to pay tribute to the great leaders of the Korean people.

articles.title: Foreigners Visit Mangyongdae
articles.content:
Foreigners Visit Mangyongdae
 Pyongyang, July 23 (KCNA) -- Foreign guests, who came here to take part in the celebrations of the 60th anniversary of the victory in the great Fatherland Liberation War and international solidarity events, visited Mangyongdae, the birthplace of President Kim Il Sung, on Tuesday. 
					 They went round historic relics with keen interest, being briefed on the immortal revolutionary history of the President and patriotic and revolutionary family members in Mangyongdae. 
					
					 Raymond Ferguson, who is heading the delegation of the Australia-DPRK Association for Friendship and Culture, said as follows:
					
					 President Kim Il Sung was born in a simple family. 
					
					 He embarked upon the road of revolution in his early years, defeated the brigandish Japanese imperialists, liberated the country and built the best socialist system. 
					
					 I will widely introduce the exploits of Kim Il Sung who devoted his all to the people.

articles.title: Foreigners, Overseas Koreans Pay Floral Tribute to Statues of Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Foreigners, Overseas Koreans Pay Floral Tribute to Statues of Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
						
 Pyongyang, July 23 (KCNA) -- Foreigners and overseas Koreans, who are visiting Pyongyang to take part in the celebrations of the 60th anniversary of the victory in the great Fatherland Liberation War and international solidarity events paid floral tribute to the statues of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il on Mansu Hill on Tuesday.
					 They include delegations and delegates of foreign countries and international bodies and a congratulatory group of Koreans in Japan, the delegation of educational officials of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan, the delegation of officials of the Union of Korean Central Educational Association in Japan, a Chinese related to the anti-Japanese revolutionary struggle and a Korean in China related to the anti-Japanese revolutionary struggle.

articles.title: Floral Tribute Paid to Statues of Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Floral Tribute Paid to Statues of Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
						
 Pyongyang, July 23 (KCNA) -- The president of the Women's International Democratic Federation and a delegation of the Vietnam Women's Union Tuesday visited the statues of the great Generalissimos Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il on Mansu Hill. 
					 They laid floral baskets before the statues and paid tribute to the peerlessly great men in humblest reverence.

articles.title: Floral Baskets to Kim Jong Un
articles.content:
Floral Baskets to Kim Jong Un
 Pyongyang, July 23 (KCNA) -- The dear respected Kim Jong Un received a floral basket from Jong Il Sim, bereaved wife of DPRK Hero An Tong Su, on a visit to the DPRK on the occasion of the 60th anniversary of the Korean people's victory in the great Fatherland Liberation War.
					 The floral basekt was handed to an official concerned on Tuesday.
					
					 A floral basket to Kim Jong Un from the family of Zhou Wei, daughter of Zhou Baozhong, a Chinese related to the anti-Japanese revolutionary struggle, was also handed.

articles.title: Military Band's March Marks Anniversary of Victory in War
articles.content:
Military Band's March Marks Anniversary of Victory in War
						
 Pyongyang, July 23 (KCNA) -- The combined military band of the Korean People's Army staged a march on Monday to mark the 60th anniversary of the Korean people's victory in the Fatherland Liberation War.
					 The band solemnly played the immortal revolutionary hymns "Song of General Kim Il Sung" and "Song of General Kim Jong Il" before the statues of the great Generalissimos Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il on Mansu Hill. It then launched its march along the road in front of the Chollima Statue with the colors of the Supreme Commander and the national flag flying in its van, playing the songs of victorious advance.
					
					 People from all walks of life in the city warmly welcomed the band.
					
					 The band headed to the April 25 House of Culture through the Arch of Triumph, playing such songs as "July 27 March", "Song of National Defence" and "Advance".
					
					 Wartime songs and "Our Victory-Day July 27", "We Will Defend General Kim Jong Un at the Cost of Our Lives" and other revolutionary military music which resounded forth at the plaza of the April 25 House of Culture fully reflected the ardent will of the service personnel and people of the DPRK to hold the dear respected Kim Jong Un in high esteem and eternally glorify the ever-victorious history of Kim Il Sung's and Kim Jong Il's Korea.

articles.title: Agricultural Workers Celebrate War Victory Day
articles.content:
Agricultural Workers Celebrate War Victory Day 
						
 Pyongyang, July 23 (KCNA) -- An event of agricultural workers "We Will Glorify Ever-Victorious History under Leadership of Dear Respected Marshal Kim Jong Un" was held at the Jonsung Revolutionary Site on Tuesday to mark the 60th anniversary of the Korean people's victory in the great Fatherland Liberation War. 
					 Ri Myong Gil, chairman of the Central Committee of the Union of Agricultural Workers of Korea, made a speech at the event.
					
					 July 27 is like the day of the second liberation as the army and people of the DPRK defeated the U.S. imperialists who boasted of being "strongest" in the world under the leadership of the great Generalissimo Kim Il Sung and brought about a shining victory.
					
					 He extended the highest tribute to Kim Il Sung, who performed feats in the history of struggle against imperialism and the U.S., reflecting the unanimous reverence of all the service personnel and people of the country.
					
					 Through poem and choruses "Long Live Generalissimo Kim Il Sung" and "Our July 27" the performers praised Kim Il Sung for creating the myth of war victory admired by the world by wisely leading the fierce Fatherland Liberation War.
					
					 Poem "Korea Fights" was recited. Then the floor was taken by DPRK Hero Kim Sung Un, lecturer at the Victorious Fatherland Liberation War Museum. He recalled that the President initiated the campaign of aircraft hunters and taught the skill of hunting enemy planes to soldiers in the period of the Fatherland Liberation War.
					
					 Ro Song Hye, chief lecturer at the Jonsung Revolutionary Museum, told the story about the historic day Kim Il Sung examined and ratified the document of the Armistice Agreement.
					
					 So Kyong Sim, chairwoman of the Management Board of the Wonhwa Co-op Farm in Phyongwon County, South Phyongan Province, told about the noble personality of the President, who instilled confidence in victory into farmers, sowing seeds together with them during the war days.
					
					 Put on the stage were such numbers as female trio "Song of National Defence", male solo "The House in My Birthplace" and light music "Song of Coast Artillerymen". 
					
					 Female solo "The General's Road to the Front" highly praised the Songun leadership feats Generalissimo Kim Jong Il performed while making journeys to the forefront including Chol Pass and Mt. Osong.
					
					 Kim Sun Gil, chairman of the Sadong District, Pyongyang, Committee of the Union of Agricultural Workers of Korea, and Ri Hye Suk, chairwoman of the Management Board of the Samjigang Co-op Farm in Jaeryong County, South Hwanghae Province, vowed to uphold the Songun leadership of Kim Jong Un with increased rice production.

articles.title: Posters on "Arirang" Produced
articles.content:
Posters on "Arirang" Produced
 Pyongyang, July 23 (KCNA) -- New posters on the grand gymnastic and artistic performance "Arirang" have been produced.
					 The posters have letters "Grand Gymnastic and Artistic Performance 'Arirang', Winner of Kim Il Sung Prize" and its logo.
					
					 They reflect the history and tradition of victory of Juche Korea and development of Songun culture and art.
					
					 Depicted on a poster against the background of May Day Stadium brightly lit with fireworks is the main sculpture "Victory" of the Monument to the Victorious Fatherland Liberation War.
					
					 Pictures of Mt. Paektu and hero Ri Su Bok are given in bold relief on posters. There are also posters showing youth and children presenting beautiful dances and dynamic gymnastics full of happiness and joy.
					
					 A poster deals with the distress-torn past of the Korean people.

articles.title: Korean Stamp Exhibition Opens
articles.content:
Korean Stamp Exhibition Opens
 Pyongyang, July 23 (KCNA) -- The Korean stamp exhibition opened to mark the 60th anniversary of the victory in the great Fatherland Liberation War.
					 Displayed in the exhibition were portraits of smiling President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il and the enlarged photo of a stamp portraying the dear respected Kim Jong Un.
					
					 Stamps portraying feats of the President in leading the hard-fought war to victory included souvenir sheet "The great leader Comrade Kim Il Sung addressing Pyongyang city mass rally celebrating the victory in the Fatherland Liberation War" and sheetlet "The great leader Comrade Kim Il Sung working out a plan for bringing about a great turn across the country".
					
					 There were also stamps praising the leadership feats of Kim Jong Il, who trained the revolutionary armed forces of Korea into the powerful revolutionary Paektusan army with his outstanding Songun revolutionary leadership and of Kim Jong Un, who is glorifying the ever-victorious history and tradition.
					
					 Also on display are stamps of diverse themes presented by lots of philatelists.
					
					 An opening ceremony took place at the Korean Stamps Museum Tuesday.
					
					 Present there were Vice-Premier Kim Yong Jin, Minister of Post and Telecommunications Sim Chol Ho, officials concerned, creators, philatelists and other people.
					
					 Present there on invitation were officials in charge of cultural and friendly relations of foreign embassies here.
					
					 Ho Song Gil, director of the State Stamp Bureau of the DPRK, made an opening speech.
					
					 The participants went round stamps on display.

articles.title: Posters Created to Mark War Victory Day
articles.content:
Posters Created to Mark War Victory Day
 Pyongyang, July 23 (KCNA) -- Posters were created in the DPRK to mark the 60th anniversary of the victory in the great Fatherland Liberation War.
					 Seen on the posters are letters reading "Victory, July 27", "War Victory, Celebration of 60th Anniversary" and "July 27, Celebration", reflective of the immense pride and self-esteem of the army and people of the DPRK.
					
					 Posters portray a fluttering flag of the DPRK with gorgeous fireworks in the background with letters "We won as we were led by the great leader!" and "Respects to the great age."
					
					 They feature feats performed by great strategist and legendary hero Generalissimo Kim Il Sung in leading the hard-fought war to a shining victory as well as the indomitable revolutionary spirit and popular heroism displayed by the army and people of the DPRK during the war.
					
					 The poster with letters "Victory in great Fatherland Liberation War" portray statue "Victory", main theme sculpture of the Monument to the Victorious Fatherland Liberation War, in the center with the nocturnal sky decorated with amazing fireworks in the background.
					
					 Another poster portrays the brightly shining star of Marshal, letters "Great victory of Songun politics" and arms and equipment demonstrating the might of the revolutionary armed forces of the DPRK.
					
					 There is also poster showing the service personnel, worker, farmer and intellectual greeting the great auspicious event with high political enthusiasm and labor feats and letters reading "To greet 65th anniversary of DPRK and 60th anniversary of victory in war as grand festivals of victors!"

articles.title: 1st National Taekwon-Do Star Contest for Jonsung Cup Starts
articles.content:
1st National Taekwon-Do Star Contest for Jonsung Cup Starts
						
 Pyongyang, July 23 (KCNA) -- The 1st national Taekwon-Do star contest for Jonsung Cup opened with due ceremony on the occasion of the 60th anniversary of victory in the Fatherland Liberation War.
					 Taekwon-Do and Go game were divided into three groups -- adult, youth and juvenile. Players selected from provincial Taekwon-Do teams, sports universities, sports schools and schoolchildren's palaces and halls in Pyongyang and local areas, will compete at the games. 
					
					 An opening ceremony took place in Wonsan, Kangwon Province on Tuesday.
					
					 Present at the opening ceremony were Pak Jong Nam, chief secretary of the Kangwon Provincial Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, and officials concerned.
					
					 Pae Nung Man, vice-chairman of the Korean Taekwon-Do Committee, made an opening speech.
					
					 Then followed demonstrations by players of each provincial Taekwon-Do team.

articles.title: Congratulatory Message to Kim Jong Un from Participants in E-Conference
articles.content:
Congratulatory Message to Kim Jong Un from Participants in E-Conference
 Pyongyang, July 23 (KCNA) -- The dear respected Kim Jong Un received a congratulatory message on July 16 from the participants in the E-Conference of the Asia-Pacific Region to Celebrate the 60th V-Day of the Korean People in the Great Fatherland Liberation War.
					 The message noted all the participants praised the undying exploits President Kim Il Sung performed by bringing about a brilliant victory in the war, building a socialist state centered on the popular masses where the people have become masters of everything and everything serves them.
					
					 When the country faced the hardest trial, leader Kim Jong Il pursued original Songun politics, humbling the arrogance of the U.S., defended the destiny of socialist Korea and thus made great contributions to the reunification of Korea and the global peace, it noted.
					
					 It expressed full support and solidarity to the Korean people in their struggle to put an end to the nation's division and realize durable peace and reunification of the Korean Peninsula, rallied close around Kim Jong Un.
					
					 It is an urgent task of not only the Korean people but the world progressives to establish a mechanism for ensuring durable peace on the Korean Peninsula and to achieve the independent and peaceful reunification of Korea in line with the intention of the Korean people.
					
					 We will fully support all the lines and proposals set forth by Kim Jong Un for the peace and reunification of Korea and peace and security of the world, true to the behests of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il, and always stand on the side of the Korean people who are under the wise leadership of Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: E-Conference of Asia-Pacific Region Held to Celebrate 60th War V-Day of Korean People
articles.content:
E-Conference of Asia-Pacific Region Held to Celebrate 60th War V-Day of Korean People 
 Pyongyang, July 23 (KCNA) -- An E-Conference of the Asia-Pacific Region to Celebrate the 60th V-Day of the Korean People in the Great Fatherland Liberation War took place in Pakistan on July 16.
					 On display in the venue were photos showing the undying exploits of President Kim Il Sung and the Songun revolutionary leadership feats of Kim Jong Il and the dear respected Kim Jong Un.
					
					 Also displayed there were works of the peerlessly great men of Mt. Paektu and photos showing the invincible might of Songun Korea.
					
					 Present there were the chiefs of organizations for friendship and solidarity with the Korean people and groups for the study of the Juche idea in various countries including Pakistan, Mongolia, Nepal, Philippines, New Zealand, Australia and Japan, and delegates of the Asia-Pacific Regional Committee for Supporting Peaceful Reunification of Korea and personages of various circles in Pakistan.
					
					 Praising the exploits the President performed by leading the war to victory, the speakers said leader Kim Jong Il steadfastly carried forward the tradition of invincibility of the DPRK provided by the President, and that supreme leader Kim Jong Un has added brilliance to it.
					
					 They affirmed that the DPRK would achieve a final victory in the showdown with the U.S. as it is led by Kim Jong Un.
					
					 A congratulatory message to Kim Jong Un was adopted at the e-conference.
					
					 It was followed by the release of an appeal to organizations for friendship and solidarity with the Korean people in the Asia-Pacific region and other parts in the world. 
					
					 The appeal said:
					
					1. To hold more vigorously in various forms and ways the celebration events of the Korean people's 60th V-Day such as celebration gatherings, lectures, photo exhibitions, film shows and so on, dedicated to the immortal feats of war victory performed by President Kim Il Sung, the great leader of the Korean people!
					
					2. To extend full support and solidarity to the Korean people in their struggle to convert the armistice system, a legacy of the Korean war, to the system of durable peace at an earliest date in accordance with the current situation on the Korean Peninsula where the armistice agreement has already been reduced to a scrap of paper!
					
					3. To represent themselves in the 60th V-Day celebration events in the DPR Korea dedicated to the great victory of the Korean people in their Fatherland Liberation War, and thus positively contribute to greeting it as a great event common to the anti-imperialist independent forces and the world progressives, and take this occasion to stage a grand international peace march from Pyongyang to Kaesong, a city of the Military Demarcation Line, sending firm support and solidarity to the Korean people in their righteous cause for peace and reunification of Korea!

articles.title: Korean People's War Victory Day Observed Abroad
articles.content:
Korean People's War Victory Day Observed Abroad
						
 Pyongyang, July 23 (KCNA) -- Events took place in various countries between July 12 and 19 to mark the 60th anniversary of the Korean people's victory in the great Fatherland Liberation War.
					 They included seminars held by the Communist Party of Tajikistan and the Bangladeshi Group for the Study of Songun Politics, a photo exhibition held by the Art and Cultural Council of the Ministry of Federal Capital Territory of Nigeria and a reading session and film show held at a construction site in Guinea.
					
					 On display in the venue of the photo exhibition were photos showing the exploits President Kim Il Sung performed by leading the war to victory.
					
					 Also displayed there were photos dealing with the successes the service personnel and people of the DPRK have performed in the building of a thriving nation under the leadership of the dear respected Kim Jong Un.
					
					 Participants in the film show watched films denouncing the crimes committed by the U.S. imperialists after igniting the Korean war.
					
					 The chairman of the Communist Party of Tajikistan said the historic victory of the Korean people in the Fatherland Liberation War would have been unthinkable without the superb military strategy and tactics of Kim Il Sung.
					
					 Speakers including the chairman of the Bangladeshi Group for the Study of Songun Politics said Kim Il Sung inflicted an ignominious defeat, the first of its kind in history, upon the U.S. in the war though it boasted of being "the strongest" in the world, and thus firmly defended the sovereignty and dignity of the DPRK. He shattered the myth of the U.S. "mightiness" and created the myth of the DPRK's invincibility, they added.  
					
					 The Korean people under the Songun revolutionary leadership of the dear respected Kim Jong Un are dynamically advancing along the road of independence, Songun and socialism, shattering the moves of the imperialists to stifle the DPRK, they stressed.
					
					 The director of the Art and Cultural Council of the Ministry of Federal Capital Territory of Nigeria said the DPRK could defeat the U.S.-led imperialist allied forces thanks to the outstanding strategy and tactics, original war methods, superb stratagem and commanding art of Kim Il Sung.

articles.title: Korean People's War Victory Day Marked in Foreign Countries
articles.content:
Korean People's War Victory Day Marked in Foreign Countries 
						
 Pyongyang, July 23 (KCNA) -- A political party and organizations of Russia, Nigeria and Brazil posted articles on their websites between July 7 and 12 to mark the 60th anniversary of the Korean people's victory in the great Fatherland Liberation War.
					 The Khabarovsk Territorial Committee of the Communist Party of the Russian Federation in an article titled "U.S. imperialists ignited the Korean war" noted the 1950-1953 Korean war was the hardest-fought war after the Second World War.
					
					 The article noted:
					
					 The U.S. imperialists hurled their troops into the southern half of the Korean Peninsula, a geopolitically important region, under the mask of "liberators" in a bid to militarily dominate the Asian Continent. They turned south Korea into a pro-U.S. "state" and into a region totally dependent on the U.S. politically, economically and militarily.
					
					 At that time, the U.S. sought a way for weathering its economic crisis in provoking the Korean war.
					
					 The ignition of the war was also required for saving the Syngman Rhee's puppet regime from its collapse due to the mounting anti-"government" spirit in south Korea.
					
					 The history clearly proves who provoked the war.
					
					 The Nigerian National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea posted an article titled "National treasure retrieved in the crucible of the war". Noting President Kim Il Sung organized an operation to retrieve the national treasures from the danger of destruction in the days of the war and took measures to preserve them, the article highly praised him for his strong sense of patriotism.
					
					 The Brazilian Committee for Solidarity with the DPRK posted on its website an article introducing the battle for liberating Taejon, a shining example of modern siege warfare set during the Fatherland Liberation War.

articles.title: Anniversary of Korean People's Victory in War Observed Abroad
articles.content:
Anniversary of Korean People's Victory in War Observed Abroad
						
 Pyongyang, July 23 (KCNA) -- Meetings were held in Benin, Myanmar and a lecture in Sweden on July 16 to mark the 60th anniversary of the Korean people's victory in the great Fatherland Liberation War.
					 Ali Houdou, president of the Socialist Party of Benin, said:
					
					 President Kim Il Sung set forth Juche-oriented military idea and theory and exerted great efforts for bolstering up the revolutionary forces all his life, adding that he always achieved victories in the do-or-die battles against the imperialists and the acute showdown with them.
					
					 Human history knows no such peerlessly brilliant commander with literary and military accomplishments as President Kim Il Sung, who emerged ever-victorious with his prominent military strategy and commanding art, bearing the brunt of the showdown with the imperialists with arms all his life.
					
					 The member of the Executive Committee of the Yangon Regional Committee of the Union Solidarity and Development Party of Myanmar said:
					
					 The U.S. imperialists provoked a war against the young DPRK to nip it in the bud and hurled even mercenaries from its satellite countries into the war.
					
					 The President put forth the original military idea that the factor of winning a victory in the war is not the level of war hardware or military technology but the service personnel and people and led the service personnel and people of the DPRK to victory with his superb strategy, tactics and war methods.
					
					 The U.S. imperialists who boasted of being the "strongest" in the world could not but bend their knees before the heroic DPRK.
					
					 The 60th anniversary of the Korean people's victory in the great Fatherland Liberation War is an auspicious event not only of the Korean people but of progressive humankind.
					
					 The Korean people will surely build a thriving nation and achieve the cause of national reunification under the leadership of the dear respected Kim Jong Un, true to the behests of the President and leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 A congratulatory message to Kim Jong Un was adopted at the meeting in Benin.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung's Exploits Performed for Victory in War Praised in Myanmar, Indonesia
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung's Exploits Performed for Victory in War Praised in Myanmar, Indonesia 
						
 Pyongyang, July 23 (KCNA) -- Personages of Myanmar and Indonesia made public statements on July 17 and 18 to mark the 60th anniversary of the Korean People's victory in the great Fatherland Liberation War. 
					 Than Tun, general director for Administrative Affairs of the Union of Myanmar Economic Holdings Limited, said in his statement:
					
					 The U.S. imperialists ignited a war against the less than two years old DPRK, but its army and people under the leadership of President Kim Il Sung, invincible and iron-willed commander, achieved shining victory by fully displaying patriotism and popular heroism. 
					
					 After the war the Korean people turned the country into an invincible socialist power, independent in politics, self-supporting in the economy and self-reliant in defence, and a powerful nuclear weapons state under the leadership of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il. 
					
					 I am sure that the great idea and exploits of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il will lead the army and people of the DPRK to a final victory. 
					
					 We extend full support and firm solidarity to the Korean people in their struggle for building a thriving nation and achieving the reunification of the country under the leadership of the dear respected Kim Jong Un. 
					
					 Shapril Arsiyad, chairman of the Indonesian Federation of Transport Workers Unions, said that the victory of the Korean people in the Fatherland Liberation War was a brilliant result of the outstanding strategies and tactics and unique military war methods of the President. 
					
					 He went on:
					
					 The U.S. is still leaving no means untried to stifle the DPRK, straining the situation on the Korean Peninsula to an extreme phase. 
					
					 The army and people of the DPRK led by Marshal Kim Jong Un who is carrying forward the Songun revolutionary cause of the great Generalissimos Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il will surely defeat the U.S. imperialists and accomplish the cause of national reunification.

articles.title: Credentials to Kim Yong Nam from New Thai Ambassador
articles.content:
Credentials to Kim Yong Nam from New Thai Ambassador
						
 Pyongyang, July 23 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, received credentials from new Thai Ambassador to the DPRK Wiboon Khusakul at the Mansudae Assembly Hall  Tuesday.
					 After receiving the credentials, Kim had a talk with the ambassador.

articles.title: DPRK FM Meets New Thai Ambassador
articles.content:
DPRK FM Meets New Thai Ambassador
 Pyongyang, July 23 (KCNA) -- DPRK Foreign Minister Pak Ui Chun met and had a talk with Thai Ambassador to the DPRK Wiboon Khusakul who paid a courtesy call on him Tuesday.
					 Present there were officials of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs and a staff member of the Thai embassy here.

articles.title: Fifth Round of Working-level Talks between Authorities of North and South of Korea Held
articles.content:
Fifth Round of Working-level Talks between Authorities of North and South of Korea Held
						
 Pyongyang, July 23 (KCNA) -- The fifth round of working-level talks between authorities of the north and the south of Korea for normalizing the operation in the Kaesong Industrial Zone (KIZ) took place in the zone on Monday.
					 At the talks, both sides sincerely discussed the contents of the draft agreement and decided to discuss some matters at the next round of the talks.
					
					 Both sides agreed to hold the sixth round of working-level talks in KIZ on July 25.

articles.title: DPRK, Mongolia Sign Agreement on Friendship, Cooperation
articles.content:
DPRK, Mongolia Sign Agreement on Friendship, Cooperation 
						
 Pyongyang, July 23 (KCNA) -- The Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries and the Federation of Peace and Friendship Organizations of Mongolia signed an agreement on friendship and cooperation here on Tuesday.
					 Present there from the DPRK side were Kim Jin Bom, vice-chairman of the committee, officials concerned and from the Mongolian side members of the Federation of Peace and Friendship Organizations of Mongolia led by General Secretary G. Dugarjav and staff members of the Mongolian embassy here.

articles.title: Flood Damage Grows in DPRK
articles.content:
Flood Damage Grows in DPRK
 Pyongyang, July 23 (KCNA) -- Flood damage by consecutive downpour and heavy rainfalls is growing in the Democratic People's Republic of Korea.
					 According to a survey made between 18:00 July 20 and 18:00 July 22, the flooding left eight people dead throughout the country.
					
					 More than 4 500 houses were destroyed or submerged, leaving 17 700 people homeless.
					
					 At least 1 000 houses were damaged totally or partially in North Phyongan Province, with 2 300 houses submerged in Unsan County alone.
					
					 6 550 hectares of cropland were damaged in North and South Phyongan provinces.
					
					 Meanwhile, the torrential rain has brought damage to some 30 school and 15 hospital buildings throughout the country as of July 23, after the start of the rainy season.

articles.title: Minju Joson on Japan's Aim to Strengthen MD
articles.content:
Minju Joson on Japan's Aim to Strengthen MD 
						
 Pyongyang, July 23 (KCNA) -- As known, the Japanese Ministry of Defense is examining the issue of introducing two more Aegis equipped with  anti-ballistic missile capabilities to make it eight.
					 Minju Joson Tuesday says in a commentary in this regard:
					
					 This reveals the Japanese reactionaries' aim to bolster the armed forces for strategic offensive.
					
					 Japan is making desperate efforts to increase the missile defense capabilities and bolster the capability of the "Self-Defense Forces" for a preemptive attack.
					
					 Japan's military action is aimed to turn the SDF into overseas aggression forces that are equipped with strategic offensive weapons and preemptive attack capabilities from the armed forces with the mission of defending the Japan proper only, and stage military operations in a world-wide scale at will.
					
					 This is a dangerous development in view of the peace and security of Northeast Asia and other parts of the world.
					
					 It is as clear as noonday that if Japan takes the road of aggression, surrounding countries will suffer disaster.
					
					 The Japanese reactionaries should behave with discretion, clearly understanding that their wild act to make the blood-stained history of aggression repeat would lead them to final destruction.

articles.title: Acting Chairman of S. Headquarters of Pomminryon Detained
articles.content:
Acting Chairman of S. Headquarters of Pomminryon Detained
						
 Pyongyang, July 23 (KCNA) -- The south Korean puppet regime on July 19 detained Kim Ul Su, acting chairman of the South Headquarters of the Pan-national Alliance for Korea's Reunification (Pomminryon), on charges of the violation of the fascist "Security Law."
					 That day the Uijongbu District Court issued a warrant of arrest for him on the suspicion of entry into "enemy-benefiting organization" and activities and threw him behind bars.
					
					 The puppet regime is getting hell-bent on the wholesale suppression, arresting hardcore members of the South Headquarters of the Pomminryon in the wake of searching their houses on June 26.

articles.title: Punishment of Traitor Chun Doo Hwan Urged
articles.content:
Punishment of Traitor Chun Doo Hwan Urged 
						
 Pyongyang, July 23 (KCNA) -- The south Korean media are calling for punishing former military dictator Chun Doo Hwan.
					 The MBC broadcasting said on July 17 that search into houses and offices of Chun and his families and relatives resulted in discovery of property worth a huge amount of dollars.
					
					 This gave the lie to Chun's assertion that he has only 290 000 won in his deposit book.
					
					 Chun has led a luxurious life through the connivance of the prosecution. Even though the prosecution knew that part of the confidential funds collected by Chun have been kept by his son, it has not withdrew them.
					
					 The prosecution has responsibility for finding out the origin of Chun's funds and collecting them.
					
					 KBS on July 18 said that children of Chun keep in stock property worth over 100 billion won, adding that this arouses doubt as to whether the origin of the asset is Chun's confidential funds or not.
					
					 Hangyore and Kyunghyang Daily in editorials on July 17 said that it is unpardonable that the military dictator who lined his pocket with dark money running at astronomical amount is allowed to hand it over to his children.
					
					 Chun has been able to lead a safe life with his property hidden behind because of the prosecution's indolent execution of law and dereliction of duty, they said, urging the need to discover all his hidden property, though belatedly.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un Praised by Austrian Organization
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Praised by Austrian Organization
						
 Pyongyang, July 23 (KCNA) -- The Society for the Promotion of the Relations between Austria and DPRK posted on its website an article titled "The most famous commander demonstrating the might of the great Paektusan nation" on July 17 to mark the first anniversary of the awarding of the title of DPRK Marshal to Supreme Commander of the Korean People's Army Kim Jong Un. The article was illustrated with a photo of him inspecting a KPA unit.
					 Noting the awarding of the title of DPRK Marshal to Kim Jong Un a year ago was an expression of boundless reverence of the service personnel and people for him and a significant event which demonstrated their firm will to deeply trust and follow him, the article said:
					
					 Kim Jong Un, who prized arms at his early age and considered the accomplishment of the cause of Songun revolution as his life-long mission under the guidance of Kim Jong Il, has trained the KPA into an elite invincible revolutionary army and further developed the DPRK into a world-class military power.
					
					 He is the most famous commander and invincible and iron-willed commander who is fully demonstrating the dignity and might of the great Paektusan nation with profound reverence for the great Generalissimos Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's Work Published in Indonesia
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's Work Published in Indonesia
						
 Pyongyang, July 23 (KCNA) -- The Hekadaha Printing and Publishing House of Indonesia published in pamphlet the dear respected Kim Jong Un's work "Let Us Brilliantly Accomplish the Revolutionary Cause of Juche, Holding Kim Jong Il in High Esteem as the Eternal General Secretary of Our Party" on July 19.
					 The work, published on April 6, Juche 101 (2012), clarifies that it is a principled requirement for victoriously advancing the cause of the Korean revolution to hold leader Kim Jong Il in high esteem as  eternal general secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK).
					
					 It sets forth the tasks to be fulfilled to steadily develop the WPK into a glorious party of President Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un recibe mensaje de felicitacion de presidente siriaco
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un recibe mensaje de felicitacion de presidente siriaco
						
Pyongyang, 23 de julio (ACNC) -- El Mariscal Kim Jong Un, Primer Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, recibio un mensaje de felicitacion que le dirigiera el dia 21 el presidente de la Republica Arabe de Siria, Bashar al-Assad.
					El mensaje senala como sigue:
					
					Le rindo homenaje.
					
					Con motivo del 27 de julio de 2013, 60o aniversario de la victoria en la Guerra de Liberacion de la Patria, me siento alegre por dedicar la mas calurosa felicitacion en nombre del pueblo arabe siriaco y en el propio mio a Su Excelencia y  al amistoso pueblo coreano y le formulo votos por buena salud y felicidad y al amistoso pueblo coreano la prosperidad.
					
					Aprovecho esta oportunidad para expresar mi conviccion de que se fortaleceran de continuo las relaciones de amistad y cooperacion existentes entre la Republica Arabe de Siria y la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea conforme a los intereses de los pueblos de los dos paises.
					
					Reciba mi mas alta consideracion.

articles.title: Trabajadores agricolas celebran acto por el dia de victoria en guerra
articles.content:
Trabajadores agricolas celebran acto por el dia de victoria en guerra
						
Pyongyang, 23 de julio (ACNC) -- En homenaje al 60o aniversario de la victoria en la Guerra de Liberacion de la Patria, tuvo lugar el dia 23 en el lugar de interes historico-revolucionario de Jonsung la escena de festejo de los trabajadores agricolas "Glorificaremos eternamente la historia de victorias siempre siguiendo la direccion del Mariscal Kim Jong Un".
					  En el acto pronuncio discurso el presidente del Comite Central de la Union de Trabajadores Agricolas de Corea, Ri Myong Gil.
					
					  El dijo que el 27 de julio es el dia de segunda liberacion en que bajo la direccion del Generalisimo Kim Il Sung, el ejercito y el pueblo de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea alcanzaron fulminante victoria rechazando a los imperialistas yanquis que se jactaban de la "supremacia" mundial.
					
					  Rendimos homenaje al Generalisimo, quien acumulo grandes hazanas en la historia de lucha antiimperialista y antiyanqui, recogiendo la unanime voluntad de todos los militares y habitantes del pais, expreso.
					
					  En la poesia y el coro "!Viva el Generalisimo Kim Il Sung!" y "27 de julio, dia de la victoria", los ejecutantes elogiaron las hazanas del Presidente Kim Il Sung quien al conducir la ardua guerra a la victoria, creo el milagro del triunfo en la guerra que admira al mundo. 
					
					  Despues de recitada la poesia "Corea lucha", el heroe de la Republica, Kim Sung Un, quien trabaja como conferenciante del Museo Conmemorativo de la Victoria en la Guerra de Liberacion de la Patria, recordo que en el periodo de la guerra, el Presidente Kim Il Sung tomo la iniciativa del movimiento de equipos de cazadores de aviones enemigos y enseno a los soldados del Ejercito Popular las claves de caza.
					
					  La conferenciante responsable del Museo de la Historia Revolucionaria de Jonsung, Ro Song Hye, hablo del historico dia en que el Presidente averiguo y firmo el documento del Acuerdo de Armisticio.
					
					  La presidenta de la junta administrativa de la Granja Cooperativa de Wonhwa del distrito de Phyongwon de la provincia de Phyong-an del Sur, So Kyong Sim, rememoro las nobles personalidades del Presidente contando que en los dias de guerra, el infundio la fe en la victoria a los campesinos sembrando personalmente con ellos las semillas.
					
					  En la escena se pusieron el trio femenino "Cancion de la defensa de la Patria", el solo masculino "La querida casa en mi tierra natal" y la musica ligera "Cancion de artilleros costeros", etc.
					
					  En el solo femenino "Camino del frente que recorre el General", la ejecutante elogio las hazanas hechas en su direccion mediante el Songun por el Generalisimo Kim Jong Il quien realizo sin parar la inspeccion a los puestos en el frente como los montes Chol y Osong.
					
					  Kim Sun Gil, presidente del Comite de la Union de Trabajadores Agricolas en el capitalino municipio de Sadong, y Ri Hye Suk, presidenta de la junta administrativa de la Granja Cooperativa de Samjigang del distrito de Jaeryong de la provincia de Hwanghae del Sur, manifestaron la decision de apoyar fielmente con la produccion de cereales la direccion del Songun del Mariscal Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: Publicadas nuevas pancartas sobre la funcion "Arirang"
articles.content:
Publicadas nuevas pancartas sobre la funcion "Arirang"
						
Pyongyang, 23 de julio (ACNC) -- En la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea se crearon nuevas pancartas referentes a la funcion gimnastico-artistica masiva "Arirang".
					Los afiches, en que se ven la frase "Funcion gimnastico-artistica masiva 'Arirang', laureada con el Premio Kim Il Sung" y la insignia de ella, muestran la historia y tradiciones de victoria de la Corea del Juche y el aspecto de la cultura del Songun en desarrollo.
					
					Se distingue otra pieza en que esta dibujada la escultura "Victoria", tema principal del Monumento a la Victoria en la Guerra de Liberacion de la Patria, la cual tiene en su trasfondo el Estadio Primero de Mayo adornado con fuegos artificiales.
					
					Hay tambien los afiches que tienen de relieve el monte Paektu y la imagen del heroe Ri Su Bok y demuestran a los ejecutantes cumpliendo con pasion y energia los movimientos coreograficos y gimnasticos.
					
					Salta a la vista el otro que hace recordar el pasado martirizado del pueblo coreano.

articles.title: Marcha por avenidas capitalinas la banda militar del EPC por el 27 de Julio
articles.content:
Marcha por avenidas capitalinas la banda militar del EPC por el 27 de Julio
						
Pyongyang, 23 de julio (ACNC) -- Tuvo lugar el dia 22 la marcha de la banda militar como parte de las festividades del 60o aniversario de la victoria en la Guerra de Liberacion de la Patria.
					La banda militar combinada del Ejercito Popular de Corea, que interpreto los inmortales himnos revolucionarios "Cancion del General Kim Il Sung" y "Cancion del General Kim Jong Il" ante las estatuas de bronce de estos Generalisimos erigidas en la capitalina colina Mansu, inicio la marcha en la avenida frente a la estatua de Chollima enarbolando al frente de sus columnas la bandera del Comandante Supremo y la otra nacional y tocando las canciones de victoria.
					
					A su paso por las avenidas capitalinas, los marchantes fueron acogidos con hospitalidad por los trabajadores de diferentes sectores y los jovenes y estudiantes de esta capital.
					
					Interpretando las canciones "Marcha del 27 de Julio", "Cancion de la defensa de la Patria", "Avance", "Nosotros vencimos", "Cancion del Ejercito Popular de Corea", "Cancion de aniquilamiento por asedio" y otras, la banda militar atraveso el Arco de Triunfo y se dirigio a la Casa Cultural 25 de Abril.
					
					Las filas avanzaron con el animo redoblado cuando tocaban las canciones "El General es la bandera de la victoria", "Tomaremos con mas firmeza los fusiles", "Triunfaremos bajo la bandera de Comandante Supremo" y otras.
					
					En la explanada frente a la Casa Cultural 25 de Abril se escucharon las canciones creadas en el tiempo de guerra y las otras como "27 de julio, dia de la victoria" y "Defenderemos a costa de la vida al General Kim Jong Un" en que se siente la gran fidelidad de los militares y habitantes coreanos deseosos de continuar siempre la historia de victorias de la Corea del Sol bajo la guia del Mariscal Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: Exposicion de sellos de Corea por 27 de julio
articles.content:
Exposicion de sellos de Corea por 27 de julio
						
Pyongyang, 23 de julio (ACNC) -- Quedo inaugurada la Exposicion de Sellos de Corea para celebrar el triunfo del pueblo coreano en la gran Guerra de Liberacion de la Patria.
					En la galeria estaban colgadas las fotos aumentadas alusivas a los sellos con imagenes sonrientes del Presidente Kim Il Sung y el Dirigente Kim Jong Il y la imagen del Mariscal Kim Jong Un.
					
					Los sellos intitulados "Gran Lider, camarada Kim Il Sung, pronunciando discurso en el mitin de la ciudad de Pyongyang en conmemoracion de la victoria en la Guerra de Liberacion de la Patria" (papel pequeno), "Gran Lider, camarada Kim Il Sung, madurando el proyecto de registrar gran cambio en todo el pais" (papel enterizo), etc. muestran la noble personalidad del Presidente quien condujo a la victoria la enconada guerra coreana.
					
					Estan expuestos tambien los sellos con varios temas que dan a conocer las hazanas del Dirigente, quien con su destacada direccion sobre la revolucion mediante el Songun, formo a las fuerzas armadas revolucionarias de Corea como ejercito poderoso del monte Paektu y puso en pleno manifiesto la dignidad y el gallardo aspecto de la Corea del Juche, y del Mariscal quien lleva adelante la historia y tradicion llenas de victorias.
					
					Ademas, se distinguen los sellos presentados por muchos aficionados a sellos.
					
					La ceremonia de inauguracion tuvo lugar el dia 23 en el Museo de Sellos de Corea.
					
					Estuvieron presentes el vicepremier Kim Yong Jin, el ministro de Comunicaciones Sim Chol Ho y otros funcionarios, los creadores, aficionados a sellos y trabajadores.
					
					Fueron invitados los funcionarios encargados de relaciones de cultura y amistad de las embajadas de varios paises en Corea.
					
					El presidente de la Direccion Estatal de Sellos de Corea Ho Song Gil hizo uso de la palabra de inauguracion.
					
					Los participantes pasaron revista a los sellos exhibidos.

articles.title: Inaugurado 1o concurso nacional de estrellas de Taekwon-do por Copa Jonsung
articles.content:
Inaugurado 1o concurso nacional de estrellas de Taekwon-do por Copa Jonsung
						
Pyongyang, 23 de julio (ACNC) -- Tuvo lugar hoy en Wonsan de la provincia de Kangwon la ceremonia inaugural del 1o concurso nacional de estrellas de Taekwon-do por la copa Jonsung en ocasion del 60o aniversario de la victoria en la Guerra de Liberacion de la Patria.
					En el presente conclave, las competencias de Taekwondo y go-chess se efectuaran divididas en la categoria de adultos, juniores y ninos. Y se disputaran los jugadores seleccionados en los equipos de taekwondo de todas las provincias, los institutos superiores de cultura fisica, escuelas deportivas, palacios de ninos y casas de ninos en la capital y las localidades.
					
					Estuvieron presentes en la ocasion Pak Jong Nam, secretario responsable del Comite del Partido del Trabajo de Corea en la mencionada provincia, funcionarios correspondientes y otros.
					
					El discurso del acto estuvo a cargo de Pae Nung Man, vicepresidente del Comite de Taekwon-do de Corea.
					
					Al termino del acto, hubo la demostracion modelo de los jugadores de los equipos de todas las provincias del pais.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam recibe cartas credenciales de nuevo embajador tailandes
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam recibe cartas credenciales de nuevo embajador tailandes
						
Pyongyang, 23 de julio (ACNC) -- Wiboon Khusakul presento hoy en el capitalino Palacio de los Congresos Mansudae ante el presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kim Yong Nam, sus cartas credenciales que le acreditan como nuevo embajador extraordinario y plenipotenciario del Reino de Tailandia en Corea.
					Tras recibirlas, Kim departio con el diplomatico.

articles.title: Terminada quinta ronda de conversaciones intercoreanas sobre el problema de ZIK
articles.content:
Firmado acuerdo sobre amistad y cooperacion entre entidades de Corea y de Mongolia
Pyongyang, 23 de julio (ACNC) -- Quedo rubricado el dia 23 en esta capital el acuerdo sobre la amistad y cooperacion entre el Comite de Relaciones Culturales con el Extranjero de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y la Federacion de Organizaciones de la Paz y Amistad de Mongolia.
					  En la ocasion estuvieron presentes por la parte coreana Kim Jin Bom, vicepresidente del comite arriba mencionado y otros funcionarios, y por la mongolesa los miembros de la delegacion de dicha federacion encabezada por el secretario general G. Dugarjav y los miembros de la Embajada de Mongolia en Corea.

articles.title: Firmado acuerdo sobre amistad y cooperacion entre entidades de Corea y de Mongolia
articles.content:
Terminada quinta ronda de conversaciones intercoreanas sobre el problema de ZIK
						
Pyongyang, 23 de julio (ACNC) -- Tuvo lugar el dia 22 en la Zona Industrial de Kaesong la quinta ronda de conversaciones de trabajo entre las autoridades del Norte y el Sur de Corea para normalizar las operaciones de dicha zona
					En la ocasion, ambas partes debatieron seriamente el contenido de acuerdo y decidieron consultar algunos problemas en la proxima ronda.
					
					Y acordaron celebrar el dia 25 en la ZIK la sexta ronda.

articles.title: Se reportan mas danos en la RPDC por inundacion
articles.content:
Se reportan mas danos en la RPDC por inundacion
						
Pyongyang, 23 de julio (ACNC) -- Se aumentan en la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea las perdidas humanas y materiales causadas por las lluvias torrenciales.
					Segun las estadisticas recogidas desde las 18:00 del dia 20 hasta las 18:00 del dia 22, murieron 8 personas en todo el pais.
					
					Resultaron destruidas o sumergidas mas de 4 mil 500 viviendas y mas de 17 mil 700 personas se quedaron sin hogar.
					
					En las ciudades y distritos de la provincia de Phyong-an del Norte fueron destruidas total o parcialmente mas de un mil viviendas. En el distrito de Unsan fueron sumergidas mas de 2 mil 300 viviendas.
					
					En las provincias de Phyong-an del Norte y Phyong-an del Sur han sido perjudicadas mas de 6 mil 550 hectareas de tierra cultivable.
					
					Desde el inicio de la estacion de lluvias continuas hasta la fecha, en escala nacional se reportaron destruidos mas de 30 establecimientos de educacion y 15 edificios de salud publica.
